question: Some people think children should attend extra classes after school, while others disagree. Discuss both views and give your own opinion.
text: Learning is very important in today's postmodern age. Some people think that students should attend extra classes for higher schooling as well as literacy; however, many people deny this. Although, I fully agree that taking extra classes increases students' ability to a different degree, many of its opposite results of which cannot be ignored. This upcoming article will discuss both perspectives before making any judgment.

On the one hand, the benefits of adding extra classes to a student's life can be seen in preparing for competitive exams. Particularly, Children who want to make a career out of a job at a respectable level in the future need to be educated beyond their schooling, with which they will achieve a status lifestyle by successfully passing demanding exams. For example, learners who are interested in cracking Civil Services exams in India need to work on the subjects apart from their schooling and college material to get a well-dignified job in the administration sector. Hence, participating in educational activities apart from schooling certainly helps in increasing one's knowledge skills.

On the other hand, the reason for not inculcating extra courses can be associated with disadvantages to studying more than you need to. In other words, if the student devotes all his time to studying, he will not have the opportunity to participate in essential activities like sports. As a result, he will lead a sedentary lifestyle, resulting in many diseases such as obesity, anxiety, and suffering from mental stress. For instance, students in big metropolitan cities like Delhi are suffering from mental problems including stress and anxiety due to study overload. Thus, burdensome studying might create a very difficult period for the brain to overcome, leading to unhappy growth.

In conclusion, I believe that undoubtedly, the child needs additional insight along with schooling to compete with difficult challenges that come his way in life. Nevertheless, it is also important to participate in sports and other outdoor activities rather than taking burdens beyond limits.
